00016   # Load the contents of the saved clipboard history.
00017   proc load {} {
00018 
00019     variable cliphist_file
00020     variable hist
00021 
00022     if {![catch { open $cliphist_file r } rc]} {
00023 
00024       # Read the contents of the file
00025       set contents [read $rc]
00026       close $rc
00027 
00028       # Parse the file
00029       set in_history 0
00030       foreach line [split $contents \n] {
00031         if {$line eq "clipping:"} {
00032           set in_history 1
00033           set clipping   ""
00034         } elseif {$in_history && [regexp {^\t(.*)$} $line -> str]} {
00035           append clipping "$str\n"
00036         } elseif {$in_history} {
00037           set clipping   [string range $clipping 0 end-1]
00038           set in_history 0
00039           lappend hist $clipping
00040         }
00041       }
00042       
00043     }
00044 
00045     # Handle any changes to the clipboard history depth
00046     trace variable preferences::prefs(Tools/ClipboardHistoryDepth) w cliphist::handle_cliphist_depth
00047     
00048   }
00049 
00050   ######################################################################
00051   # Saves the state of the clipboard history to a file.  This is called
00052   # prior to exiting the application.
00053   proc save {} {
00054 
00055     variable cliphist_file
00056     variable hist
00057 
00058     if {![catch { open $cliphist_file w } rc]} {
00059       foreach clipping $hist {
00060         puts $rc "clipping:"
00061         foreach line [split $clipping \n] {
00062           puts $rc "\t$line"
00063         }
00064         puts $rc ""
00065       }
00066       close $rc
00067     }
00068 
00069   }

00071   ######################################################################
00072   # Adds the current clipboard contents to the clipboard history list.
00073   proc add_from_clipboard {} {
00074 
00075     variable hist
00076 
00077     # Get the clipboard content
00078     set str [string map {\{ \\\{} [clipboard get]]
00079 
00080     if {[string trim $str] ne ""} {
00081           
00082       # If the string doesn't exist in history, add it
00083       if {[set index [lsearch -exact $hist $str]] == -1} {
00084 
00085         # Append the string to the history file
00086         lappend hist $str
00087       
00088         # Trim the history to meet the maxsize requirement, if necessary
00089         if {[llength $hist] > [preferences::get Tools/ClipboardHistoryDepth]} {
00090           set hist [lrange $hist 1 end]
00091         }
00092 
00093       # Otherwise, move the current string to the beginning of the history
00094       } else {
00095 
00096         set hist [linsert [lreplace $hist $index $index] end $str]
00097           
00098       }
00099           
00100     }
00101 
00102   }

00112   ######################################################################
00113   # Adds the current string from the clipboard history list to the clipboard
00114   # and immediately adds the string to the current text widget, formatting
00115   # the text.
00116   proc add_to_clipboard {str} {
00117 
00118     # Add the string to the clipboard
00119     clipboard clear
00120     clipboard append [string map {\\\{ \{} $str]
00121 
00122     # Insert the string in the current text widget
00123     gui::paste_and_format {}
00124 
00125   }

00127   ######################################################################
00128   # Returns the clipboard history as a list of string pairs where the
00129   # first item is the value to use in the listbox while the second pair
00130   # should be used in the full detail.
00131   proc get_history {} {
00132     
00133     variable hist
00134             
00135     set items [list]
00136             
00137     foreach item [lreverse $hist] {
00138       set lines [split $item \n]
00139       set short [lindex $lines 0]
00140       if {[llength $lines] > 1} {
00141         append short "  ..."
00142       }
00143       lappend items [list [string map {\\\{ \{} $short] [string map {\\\{ \{} $item]]
00144     }
00145                     
00146     return $items
00147     
00148   }

00181   proc handle_cliphist_depth {name1 name2 op} {
00182     
00183     variable hist

00185     if {[set diff [expr [llength $hist] - [preferences::get Tools/ClipboardHistoryDepth]]] > 0} {
